entry.title: Hexo-theme-next 如何处理 err YAMLException can not read a block mapping entry;
entry.content:
报错信息是：

我找到了 date 所在的位置，是 markdown 文件的开头，定义基本信息 Front-matter 的地方

原来是 hexo 不支持 [] 括号在文件头，Front-matter 修改成：

之后就问题解决✌️

entry.title: <Note of Phys 480> Lecture 5.2 corresponding to McIntyre Chapter 3
entry.content:
#6 Postulate

The time evolution of a quantum system is determined by the Hamiltonian or total [[Hamiltonian operator|energy operator]] \(H(t)\) through the Schrödinger equation: \[i \hbar \frac{d}{d t}|\psi(t)\rangle=\hat{H}(t)|\psi(t)\rangle\]

  • observable -> Hermitian
  • Eigenvalues: allowed energies
  • Eigenvectors: complete basis
  • Eigenstates: \(\hat{H}\left|E_{n}\right\rangle=E_{n}\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\)
  • General statevectors: \(|\psi(t)\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(t)\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\)
    • \(|\psi(t)\rangle\): time evolved state
    • \(c_{n}(t)\): time dependence live in coefficient
    • \(\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\): energy basis
Derive Schrödinger Time Evolution
  • For \(i \hbar \frac{d}{d t}|\psi(t)\rangle=\hat{H}(t)|\psi(t)\rangle\)
    • substitute with \(|\psi(t)\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(t)\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\)
  • \(i \hbar \frac{d}{d t}\left(\sum_{n} c_{n}(t)\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\right)=\widehat{H}\left(\sum_{n} c_{n}(t)\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\right)\)
  • \(i \hbar \sum_{n} \frac{d c_{n}(t)}{d t}\left|E_{n}\right\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(t) \widehat{H}(t)\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\)
  • take the inner product with a generic energy eigenstate
    • \(\left\langle E_{k}\left|i \hbar \sum_{n} \frac{d c_{n}(t)}{d t}\right| E_{n}\right\rangle=\left\langle E_{k}\left|\sum_{n} c_{n}(t) \widehat{H}\right| E_{n}\right\rangle\)
  • \(i \hbar \sum_{n} \frac{d c_{n}(t)}{d t}\left\langle E_{k} \mid E_{n}\right\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(t)\left\langle E_{k}|\widehat{H}(t)| E_{n}\right\rangle\)
    • for \(\left\langle E_{k} \mid E_{n}\right\rangle=1\) only when \(k=n\)
    • for \(\left\langle E_{k}|\widehat{H}(t)| E_{n}\right\rangle=1\) only when \(k=n\)
  • \(i \hbar \frac{d c_{k}(t)}{d t}=E_{k} c_{k}(t)\)
  • \(\frac{d c_{k}(t)}{d t}=-\left(i E_{k} / \hbar\right) c_{k}(t)\)
  • \(c_{k}(t)=c_{k}(0) e^{-i E_{k} t / \hbar}\) ^e6d634
    • solution to a 1st order DE
  • At \(t=0\)
    • \(|\psi(t=0)\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(0)\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\)
      • substitute with \(c_{k}(t)=c_{k}(0) e^{-i E_{k} t / \hbar}\) [[#^e6d634]]
  • \(|\psi(t)\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(0) e^{-i E_{n} t / \hbar}\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\)
Schrödinger Time Evolution

\[|\psi(t)\rangle=\sum_{n} c_{n}(0) e^{-i E_{n} t / \hbar}\left|E_{n}\right\rangle\]

Time-independent 2-state system (with no superposition by t=0)
  • \(|\psi(t=0)\rangle=\left|E_{1}\right\rangle\)
  • \(|\psi(t)\rangle=e^{-i E_{1} t / \hbar}\left|E_{1}\right\rangle\)
  • \(\wp=\left|\left\langle a_{1} \mid \psi(t)\right\rangle\right|^{2}=\left|\left\langle a_{1}\left|e^{-i E_{1} t / \hbar}\right| E_{1}\right\rangle\right|^{2}=\left|\left\langle a_{1} \mid E_{1}\right\rangle\right|^{2}\)
Time-independent 2-state system (with superposition by t=0)
  • \(|\psi(t=0)\rangle=c_{1}\left|E_{1}\right\rangle+c_{2}\left|E_{2}\right\rangle\)
  • \(|\psi(t)\rangle=c_{1} e^{-i E_{1} t / \hbar}\left|E_{1}\right\rangle+c_{2} e^{-i E_{2} t / \hbar}\left|E_{2}\right\rangle\)
  • \(\wp=\left|\left\langle E_{1} \mid \psi(t)\right\rangle\right|^{2}=\mid\left\langle E_{1}\left|\left(c_{1} e^{-i E_{1} t / \hbar}\left|E_{1}\right\rangle+c_{2} e^{-i E_{2} t /\hbar}\left|E_{2}\right\rangle\right)\right|^{2}\right.=\left|c_{1}\right|^{2}\)
  • For any other observable \(A\left|a_{1}\right\rangle=a_{1}\left|a_{1}\right\rangle\)
    • \([A,H]=0\)
    • \(A\) and \(H\) must share an eigen-basis
    • \(\left|a_{1}\right\rangle\) is an energy eigenstate
    • probability of measuring eigenvalue \(a_{1}\) depends on time
Problems of looking for probabilities of eigenvalues

[[Pasted image 20211108091659.png]]

Spectroscopy experiment

Spectroscopy experiment is a measurement of the energy of the quantum state.

[[C5 Lecture 7.2|In chapter 5]], we will learn how to predict the allowed energy eigenstates of a particular system given the Hamiltonian of the system. [[C5 Lecture 7.2]][[C5 Lecture 8.2]][[C5 Lecture 9.1]]

Spin Precession
  • Spin-1/2 system

entry.title: <Math 165 Review> 04 Squeeze Theorem; one-side limits
entry.content:
• [[Squeeze Theorem]] ([[Squeeze Theorem|Sandwich Theorem]]):
    • If near \(\mathrm{c}\) we have \({g}({x}) \leqslant {f}({x}) \leqslant {h}({x})\)
    • and we have \(\lim _{x \rightarrow c} g(x)=\lim _{x \rightarrow c} h(x)=L\)
    • then we also have \(\lim _{x \rightarrow c} f(x)=L\)
  • [[Limit|One-sided limits]]
    • Left limit: \(\lim _{x \rightarrow c^{-}} f(x)\)
    • Right limit: \(\lim _{x \rightarrow c^{+}} f(x)\)
    • Why we need sided limits?
      • Function only defined on one side
      • Piece-wise functions
    • [[Limit|One-sided Limits Lemma]]:
      • \(\lim _{x \rightarrow c} f(x)=L\)
      • if and only if \(\lim _{x \rightarrow c^{-}} f(x)=\lim _{x \rightarrow c^{+}} f(x)=L\)
  • Special [[Limit]] \(\sin (\theta) / \theta\)
    • \(\cos \theta \leqslant \frac{\sin (\theta)}{\theta}<1\)
    • prove \(\frac{\sin \theta}{\theta}\) is even
    • near \(0\)? \(\cos \theta<\frac{\sin \theta}{\theta}<1\)
    • \(\lim _{\theta \rightarrow 0} \frac{\sin \theta}{\theta}=1\)
  • Odd function and Even function
    • Odd: \(\sin x, \tan x, x, x^{3}, e^{x}-e^{-x}, \ldots\)
    • Even: \(\cos x, \sec x, x^{2}, x^{4}, e^{x}+e^{-x}, \ldots\)

entry.title: <Math 165 Review> 03 Technical definition of limits
entry.content:
• Meaning of [[Limit]]: What should happen to a function
  • Distance: \(|x-y|\)
  • Formal Definition of [[Limit]]:
    • We say \(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} f(x)=L\) if
      • for any \(\varepsilon>0\)
      • there is a \(\delta>0\)
      • so that
        • if \(0<|x-a|<\delta\): we can always make \(|x-a|\) smaller
        • then \(|f(x)-L|<\varepsilon\).
  • Triangle Inequality: \(|x+y| \leqslant|x|+|y|\): break into parts both smaller

entry.title: <Math 165 Review> 02 Introduction to limits
entry.content:
• [[Slope]] \[\frac{f(b)-f(a)}{b-a}\]
  • [[Limit]] \[\lim _{x \rightarrow a} f(x)=L\]
  • [[Limit|Basic properties of limits]] \(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} f(x)=L\) and \(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} g(x)=M\)
    • \(\lim _{x \rightarrow a}(c f(x)+d g(x))=c L+d M\)
    • \(\lim _{x \rightarrow a}(f(x) g(x))=L M\)
    • \(M \neq 0, \lim _{x \rightarrow a} \frac{f(x)}{g(x)}=\frac{L}{M}\)
    • \(L>0\), \(\lim _{x \rightarrow a}(f(x))^{q}=L^{q}\)
    • Polynomial of limit \[\begin{aligned} \lim _{x \rightarrow a} f(x) &=\lim _{x \rightarrow a}\left(c_{n} x^{n}+\cdots+c_{1} x+c_{0}\right) \\ &=c_{n}\left(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} x^{n}\right)+\cdots+c_{1}\left(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} x\right)+c_{0}\left(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} 1\right) \\ &=c_{n}\left(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} x\right)^{n}+\cdots+c_{1}\left(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} x\right)+c_{0}\left(\lim _{x \rightarrow a} 1\right) \\ &=c_{n} a^{n}+\cdots+c_{1} a+c_{0}=f(a) \end{aligned}\]
  • Rational Function \[\frac{f(x)}{g(x)}\]
  • \(\frac{0}{0}\)? What to do?
    • Expanding and factoring polynomial
    • Multiplying by the conjugate
      • \((a+b)(a-b)=a^{2}-b^{2} \to \sqrt{some thing}\)
    • Use [[Triangle Identity|trig identity]]
      • \(\sin ^{2} \theta+\cos ^{2} \theta=1\)

entry.title: <Math 165 Review> 01 Average rate of change
entry.content:
• [[Slope]] for \(y=m x+b\)
    • \(slope=\frac{y_{2}-y_{1}}{x_{2}-x_{1}}=\frac{\Delta y}{\Delta x}\)
  • [[Slope|Average rate of change]]
